meanings.sent1: She knelt down to tie her shoelaces.
meanings.sent2: Yesterday, he knelt in front of the altar at church.
meanings.sent3: The puppy knelt beside its bowl, waiting for food.
meanings.sent4: The old tree knelt under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent5: The knight knelt before the king, ready to receive his honor.

meanings.definition: to be in or assume a position in which the body is supported by a knee or the knees, as when praying or showing submission
meanings.sent1: The gymnast knelt gracefully before starting her routine.
meanings.sent2: The protestors knelt in silence to honor the fallen soldiers.
meanings.sent3: The cat knelt in front of the closed door, waiting to be let in.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden knelt under the weight of the rain.
meanings.sent5: The student knelt in front of the teacher, asking for forgiveness.
